intro: Scelochilus ecalcaratus, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a low-growing flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early summer, typically arranged in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are typically succulent, adapted to retain moisture in arid, high-altitude environments. Scelochilus ecalcaratus is often found in rocky soils and is an important component of alpine flora communities.
